chainsaw.active.activesaw — Active chainsaw¶

class chainsaw.active.activesaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

active chainsaw

all()¶

Collect True if the active callable returns True for everything within an iterable (or if the iterable is empty).

any()¶

Collect True if the active callable returns True for anything within an iterable (or if the iterable is empty).

append(thing)¶

Insert thing after any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – one incoming thing
appendstart(thing)¶

Insert thing before any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – one incoming thing
argmap(merge=False)¶

Feed each thing within an iterable as wildcard positional arguments to the active callable.

Parameters:merge –

combine global positional arguments with wildcard positional arguments from an iterable (default: False)
arguments(*args, **kw)¶

Assign any positional and/or keyword arguments to be used anytime the active callable or alternative callable is invoked.

as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode each incoming thing with the 'ascii' codec.

Parameters:errors – error handling for decoding issues (default: 'strict')
classmethod as_auto()¶

Switch to context where incoming things are automatically rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode each incoming thing.

Parameters:
  • encoding – Unicode encoding (default: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling for encoding issues (default: 'strict')
as_deque()¶

Set iterable wrapper to list each incoming thing.

as_dict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to dict each incoming thing.

as_edit()¶

Switch to editing context where operations can be performed on incoming things from initial placement to final extraction.

as_frozenset()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenset each incoming thing.

as_frozenstuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenstuf each incoming thing.

as_list()¶

Set iterable wrapper to deque each incoming thing.

classmethod as_manual()¶

Switch to context where incoming things must be manually rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_many()¶

Switch to performing operations on each incoming thing as just one individual thing in a series of many individual things.

as_one()¶

Switch to performing operations on incoming things as one whole thing.

as_ordereddict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to OrderedDict.

as_orderedstuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to orderedstuf each incoming thing.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to set each incoming thing.

as_stuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to stuf each incoming thing.

as_truth()¶

Switch to evaluation context where the results of operations on incoming things determine which of two potential paths to execute. After exiting the evaluation context by invoking which, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of incoming things so further operations can be performed on an unmodified baseline version.

as_tuple()¶

Set iterable wrapper to tuple each incoming thing.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to unicode (str under Python 3) decode each incoming thing.

Parameters:
  • encoding – Unicode encoding (default: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling for decoding issues (default: 'strict')
as_view()¶

Switch to query context where the results of operations on incoming things queried. Upon exit from query context by invoking results or end, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of so that further operations can be performed on an unmodified baseline version.

at(n, default=None)¶

Slice off a thing found at n position within an iterable or default if nothing is found at n.

Parameters:
  • n – index of some thing
  • default – default thing (default:: None)
attributes(deep=False, ancestors=False, *names)¶

Collect attributes from things within an iterable by by matching their attribute names.

average()¶

Collect average thing within an iterable.

balanced¶

If incoming and outgoing things are in balance.

choice()¶

Slice off a thing at random from an iterable.

clear()¶

Clear out everything.

clear_in()¶

Clear incoming things.

clear_out()¶

Clear outgoing things.

combinations(n)¶

Find every possible combination of each n things within an iterable.

Parameters:n – length of things to derive combinations from
copy()¶

Duplicate each thing within an iterable.

count()¶

Collect the number of times each thing occurs within an iterable. Returns a tuple consisting of (least common thing, most common thing, count of everything consisting of a list of tuple pairs of (thing, count).

difference(symmetric=False)¶

Collect differences within a series of iterables.

Parameters:symmetric – use symmetric difference (default: False)
disjointed()¶

Collect disjoints within a series of iterables.

duality()¶

Divide an iterable into two iterables based on whether the active callable returns True or False for each thing within an iterable.

end()¶

Return outgoing things, cleaning out everything afterwards.

extend(things)¶

Insert things after any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
extendstart(things)¶

Insert things before any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
filter(invert=False)¶

Collect everthing within an iterable that the active callable matches.

Parameters:invert – return things for which the filter is False rather than True (default: False)
first(n=0)¶

Slice either n things from the start end of an iterable or the first thing within an iterable.

Parameters:n – number of things (default:: 0)
flatten()¶

Flatten nested things within an iterable.

group()¶

Collect things within an iterable grouped using the active callable as the key function.

initial()¶

Slice off everything within an iterable except the very last thing.

intersection()¶

Collect intersections within a series of iterables.

invoke(name)¶

Call method name from each thing within an iterable with the global positional and keyword arguments but collect the original thing instead of the value returned by calling the method if the return value of the method call is None.

Parameters:name – method name
items(*keys)¶

Collect everything from things (usually sequences or mappings) within an iterable that matches *keys.

Parameters:*keys –

item keys or indexes
kwargmap(merge=False)¶

Feed each thing within an iterable as a tuple of wildcard positional and keyword arguments to the active callable.

Parameters:merge –

combine global positional and keyword arguments with positional and keyword arguments from an iterable into a single tuple of wildcard positional and keyword arguments for the active callable (default: False)
last(n=0)¶

Slice off either n things from the tail end of an iterable or just the last thing within an iterable.

Parameters:n – number of things (default:: 0)
map()¶

Feed each thing within an iterable to the active callable.

mapping(keys=False, values=False)¶

Collect all items, keys, or` within an iterable of mappings.

Parameters:
  • keys – collect keys only (default: False)
  • values – collect values only (default: False)
max()¶

Collect maximum thing within an iterable using the active callable as the key function.

median()¶

Collect median thing within an iterable.

merge()¶

Combine an iterable of multiple things into one thing.

min()¶

Collect minimum thing within an iterable using the active callable as the key function.

minmax()¶

Collect minimum and maximum things within an iterable as a tuple consisting of (minimum value, maximum value).

partition(pattern=None, flags=0)¶

Collect two iterables divided into True and False based on whether the active callable returns True or False for each thing within an iterable. The active callable is used as the filter unless regular expression pattern is supplied, in which case pattern is used as the filter.

Parameters:
  • pattern – regular expression search pattern (default: None)
  • flags – regular expression flags (default: 0)
pattern(pattern, flags=0, compiler='parse')¶

Compile a pattern and use it as the active callable.

Parameters:
  • pattern – regular expression search pattern
  • flags –

    regular expression flags (default: 0)

  • compiler – which engine to compile the pattern with. Valid options are ‘parse’, ‘re’, or ‘glob’ (default: ‘parse’)
permutations(n)¶

Find every possible permutation of each n things within an iterable.

Parameters:n – length of things to derive permutations from
preview()¶

Take a peek at the current state of outgoing things.

product(n=1)¶

Repeat results of nested iterables n times.

Parameters:n – number of loops to repeat (default: 1)
range()¶

Collect length of the smallest interval that can contain each thing within an iterable.

reduce(initial=None, reverse=False)¶

Reduce an iterable down to one thing using the active callable.

Parameters:
  • initial – starting value (default:: None)
  • reverse –

    reduce from the right side of an iterable (default:: False)
repeat(n=None, call=False)¶

Repeat either an iterable or the results of invoking the active callable n times.

Parameters:
  • n – number of times to repeat (default: None)
  • call – repeat result of active callable (default: False)
rest()¶

Slice off everything within an iterable except the very first thing.

results()¶

Return outgoing things, clearing outgoing things afterwards.

reverse()¶

Collect the current order of things within an iterable.

sample(n)¶

Slice off a random sample of n things within an iterable.

Parameters:n – size of sample
shift_in()¶

Manually copy outgoing things back to incoming things.

shift_out()¶

Manually copy incoming things to outgoing things.

shuffle()¶

Collect things within an iterable that have been randomly rearranged from their previous order.

slice(start, stop=False, step=False)¶

Slice off things within an iterable.

Parameters:
  • start – starting index of slice
  • stop – stopping index of slice (default: False)
  • step – size of step in slice (default: False)
snapshot(baseline=False, original=False)¶

Take a snapshot of current incoming things.

Parameters:
  • baseline – make this snapshot the baseline snapshot (default: False)
  • original – make this snapshot the original snapshot (default: False)
sort()¶

Collect things within an iterable sorted using the active callable as the key function.

split(n, fill=None)¶

Slice an iterable into multiple iterables of n things while using fill to pad out results that fall short of n.

Parameters:
  • n – number of things per split
  • fill – value to pad out incomplete things (default: None)
subset()¶

Collect True if an iterable is a subset of another iterable.

sum(start=0, floats=False)¶

Collect total from adding up start and each thing within an iterable.

Parameters:
  • start – starting number (default: 0)
  • floats – add floats with extended precision (default: False)
superset()¶

Collect True if an iterable is a superset of another iterable.

tap(call, alt=None, factory=False)¶

Assign active callable. Optionally assign an alternative callable. If factory flag is set to True, use the callable passed with the call argument as a factory to build the active callable.

Parameters:
  • call – callable assigned as active callable
  • alt – callable assigned as alternative callable (default: None)
  • factory – whether call is a factory that produces callables (default: False)
traverse(ancestors=False, invert=False)¶

Collect everthing from things within an iterable or their ancestors that the active callable matches.

Parameters:
  • ancestors – collect things from parents of a thing based on method resolution order (MRO) (default: False)
  • invert – return things for which the filter is False rather than True (default: False)
undo(snapshot=0, baseline=False, original=False)¶

Revert incoming things to a previous snapshot of incoming things.

Parameters:
  • snapshot – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3, etc. (default: 0)
  • baseline – revert incoming things to baseline snapshot ( default: False)
  • original – revert incoming things to original snapshot ( default: False)
union()¶

Collect the union of things within a series of iterables.

unique()¶

Collect unique things within an iterable.

untap()¶

Clear any active callable, alternative callable, or assigned position or keywork arguments.

unwrap()¶

Set iterable wrapper to deque each incoming thing.

weave()¶

Interleave every other thing from multiple iterables to make one iterable.

which(call=None, alt=None)¶

Choose active callable based on results of condition mode.

Parameters:
  • call – new callable to use if condition is True (default: None)
  • alt – new external callable to use if condition is False (default: None)
wrap(wrapper)¶

Set iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

Parameters:wrapper –

an iterable wrapper
zip()¶

Reduce multiple iterables to one iterable where every two things are paired in a tuple of (thing1, thing2) based on where they were found within the original iterable.
